column4: I am having troubles keeping my Linksys/Cisco WUSB54GC v3 [Ralink RT2870] to hold a connection. it randomly dies, and stays dead. It also is very broad in the data transfer rates, it will be fine then go super slow.  Any suggestions?
ralink stuff works better with compat-wireless drivers
can ya walk a noob thru settin that up?
i.e. linux-backports-modules-wireless-2.6.35-22-generic 2.6.35-22.12 from source linux-backports-modules-2.6.35
save us both time if you search for "compat-wireless" and the codename of your ubuntu release
will do thx.

I have a ralink chipset here on my ALFA 1/2watt wifi adapter ;)  so I noticed that it dropped wifi link with high number of network connections in the new wifi driver and compat-wireless driver works better for me
yes thats what its lookin like here.. im just new back to linux after a long long stretch away and my brain doesnt do what it used to do.  Got old and dumb.
it's like trying to hop on a moving train ;)  no worries
i just installed "2.6.35-22.12 (linux-backports-modules-wireless-2.6.35-22-generic-pae)" via ubuntu software center, is that about what i need to do?
am i literally typing "./scripts/driver-select <driver-name>
huh? oh it should be far simpler than that

i ended up using ubuntu software center to get 2.6.35-22.12 (linux-backports-modules-wireless-2.6.35-22-generic-pae) but afaik it didnt do much of anything but dl it.. i didnt dc or rc as the helps say i should
oh, did you need PAE?
the modules should match 'uname -r' output, is all.  If it says PAE in your uname output, then you need PAE, I *think*
PAE is for folks with 4+GB ram to say it simply
so if i used the ubuntu software center to get that driver.. am i good or do i need to do something to tell the system to use that driver instead of the default one?
good question, after installation of the package you will need to reboot, but that may not be enough
I remember all I had to do was reboot and the compat-wireless versions of the modules were then being used
i'm totally horked. im getting device descripptor read/64,  error -71 system does not boot
how'd you do that?
nfc... i restarted to restart the wireless like i always do.. now im sitting at a boot screen saying sorry bub you sck.
privmsg, maybe we can sort it out
